1.str2: Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.
From apostello; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
Instruction, command, order, authority. From epitasso; an injunction or decree; by implication, authoritativeness.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

1.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
1.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A savior, deliverer, preserver. From sozo; a deliverer, i.e. God or Christ.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

1.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
1.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Hope, expectation, trust, confidence. From a primary elpo; expectation or confidence.

2.str2: Timothy, a Christian of Lystra, helper of Paul. From time and theos; dear to God; Timotheus, a Christian.
From the same as genesia; legitimate, i.e. Genuine.
A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
Pity, mercy, compassion. Of uncertain affinity; compassion.
Probably from a primary verb eiro; peace; by implication, prosperity.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

2.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
2.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

3.str2: According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

3.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
3.str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.

3.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
3.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

3.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular

3.str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
(Hebrew), Macedonia, a Roman province north of Achaia (Greece). From Makedon; Macedonia, a region of Greece.
From pros and meno; to stay further, i.e. Remain in a place, with a person; figuratively, to adhere to, persevere in.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Ephesus, a coast city, capital of the Roman province Asia. Probably of foreign origin; Ephesus, a city of Asia Minor.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

3.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Singular
3.str2: To notify, command, charge, entreat solemnly. From para and the base of aggelos; to transmit a message, i.e. to enjoin.

3.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Dative Masculine Plural
3.str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
From heteros and didaskalos; to instruct differently.

4.str2: And not, not even, neither?nor. From me and de; but not, not even; in a continued negation, nor.
From pros and echo; to hold the mind towards, i.e. Pay attention to, be cautious about, apply oneself to, adhere to.
An idle tale, fable, fanciful story. Perhaps from the same as mueo; a tale, i.e. Fiction.
Unaccomplished, unending, endless. Unfinished, i.e. interminable.
Genealogy. From the same as genealogeo; tracing by generations, i.e. 'genealogy'.

Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
4.str2: From para and echo; to hold near, i.e. Present, afford, exhibit, furnish occasion.
A question, debate, controversy; a seeking, search. From zeteo; a searching, i.e. A dispute or its theme.
More, rather. Neuter of the comparative of the same as malista; more) or rather.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
Management of household affairs, stewardship, administration. From oikonomos; administration; specially, a 'economy'.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

(a) an end, (b) event or issue, (c) the principal end, aim, purpose, (d) a tax.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A command, charge, injunction; a precept, rule of living. From paraggello; a mandate.

5.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
5.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
The conscience, a persisting notion. From a prolonged form of suneido; co-perception, i.e. Moral consciousness.
Unfeigned, without hypocrisy, sincere. Undissembled, i.e. Sincere.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

6.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
6.str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

6.str2: From a compound of a and stoichos; to miss the mark, i.e. deviate from truth.

Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
6.str2: From ek and the base of trope; to deflect, i.e. Turn away.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Vain speaking, foolish talking. From mataiologos; random talk, i.e. Babble.

7.str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A teacher and interpreter of the Mosaic Law. From nomos and didaskalos; an expounder of the law, i.e. A Rabbi.

7.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
7.str2: From nous; to exercise the mind, i.e. to comprehend, heed.

Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
7.str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Nor, neither, not even, neither?nor. From me and te; not too, i.e. neither or nor; also, not even.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

7.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Genitive Neuter Plural
7.str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

7.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
7.str2: To assert emphatically. Middle voice of a compound of dia and bebaioo; to confirm thoroughly, i.e. Asseverate.

8.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

8.str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.
Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

8.str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

9.str2: To lie, recline, be placed, be laid, set, specially appointed, destined. Middle voice of a primary verb; to lie outstretched.
From dike; equitable; by implication, innocent, holy.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Lawless, wicked, without law. (by implication, a Gentile), or (positively) wicked.
Not subject to rule, unruly. Unsubdued, i.e. Insubordinate.
Impious, ungodly, wicked. Irreverent, i.e. impious or wicked.
Sinning, sinful, depraved, detestable. From hamartano; sinful, i.e. A sinner.
Permitted to be trodden, accessible. From the base of basis and belos; accessible, i.e. heathenish, wicked.
A patricide, a murderer of his father. From pater and the same as the latter part of metraloias; a parricide.
A matricide, smiter of his mother. From meter and the base of halon; a mother-thresher, i.e. Matricide.
A murderer, man-slayer. From aner and phonos; a murderer.

10.str2: A fornicator, man who prostitutes himself. From pernemi; a prostitute, i.e. a debauchee.
A male engaging in same-gender sexual activity; a sodomite, pederast. From arrhen and koite; a sodomite.
An enslaver, one who forcibly enslaves, a kidnapper. From a derivative of a compound of aner and pous; an enslaver.
A liar, deceiver. From pseudomai; a falsifier.
Perjured, sworn falsely. From epi and horkos; on oath, i.e. a forswearer.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

10.str2: From hugies; to have sound health, i.e. Be well; figuratively, to be uncorrupt.

20.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Plural
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
20.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Hymenaeus. From Humen; 'hymeneal'; Hymeneus, an opponent of Christianity.
From the same as alektor and aner; man-defender; Alexander, the name of three Israelites and one other man.

20.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
20.str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.
An adversary, Satan. Of Chaldee origin corresponding to ma'bad; the accuser, i.e. The devil.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

20.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Plural
20.str2: From pais; to train up a child, i.e. Educate, or, discipline.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
From blasphemos; to vilify; specially, to speak impiously.
